Estimating Time Required for a Task

The Task component includes a Time tab on which you can record the amount of time needed to complete a task or subtask. You can set both estimated and actual times; however, the application does not provide a roll-up mechanism for estimate, actual, and variance values.

To enter the estimated time to complete a task:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Task tab on the upper pane.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Double-click a task or subtask in the task tree or list.

    • Select a task or subtask then select Properties from the Task menu or the context menu.

    The Task Properties dialog opens.

  4. Select the Time tab.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • Use the Start drop-down calendar to enter a start date for the task.

    • Enter the date (mm/dd/yy) in the Start text box.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • Use the Finish drop-down calendar to enter the finish date for the task.

    • Enter the finish date (mm/dd/yy) in the Finish text box.

  7. Enter the estimated work (in hours) required to complete the task in the Work field.

    8. The rest of this dialog box is disabled. Microsoft Project uses these fields, but the StarTeam Task component cannot.

  8. Click OK.
